text: [Music]
this is an offensive that Iraq had been
promising for months over the skies of
Mosul the army dropped tens of thousands
of leaflets to warn people to stay in
their homes the hour of victory has
arrived and operations for the
liberation of Mosul have begun I
announced today the start of these
heroic operations to free you from the
terror and the oppression of daesh and
God willing soon we will meet on Mosul
soil Iraqi officials say more than
25,000 troops will take part in the
offensive but they face militants who
have had more than two years to dig
themselves in the capture of Mosul in
June 2014 shocked the world and became a
symbol of the emerging threat of the
so-called Islamic state group this
footage obtained by the BBC last year
gave a rare glimpse of life in the city
with mosques being blown up schools
abandoned and women forced to cover
themselves from head to toe since late
last year the Iraqi military has made a
number of gains against is militants but
the battle for Mosul is a much more
significant test Iraqi officials believe
recapturing this city would mark the
effective defeat of is in their country
Greg Dawson BBC news
